title: Document sv task in README and PRODUCT_SPECIFICATION
Spec v1 TUI UX + layout
body:
Scope: fullscreen split view (list left, detail right) + narrow mode single pane
Keymap: j/k, arrows, / filter, esc clear, q quit, r reload, ? help
Visual hierarchy: status pill, id, title, workspace; metadata row in detail
Error states: empty, load error, watch error, no selection
Deliverable: UX spec doc with wireframe sketches + keymap table
Acceptance: doc reviewed, covers v1 read-only and v2 actions placeholder

title: Perf plan + budgets for task TUI
body:
Targets: cold start <150ms @1k tasks, <300ms @5k; keypress-to-frame <16ms; reload <50ms
Strategy: retained caches + differential render + no idle ticks
Snapshot-first load; avoid log fold on startup
Profiling: SV_TASK_PROFILE=1 timing logs (load/parse/render)
Acceptance: perf plan documented + profiling spec + risk list

title: TUI architecture + module layout
body:
Stack: ratatui + crossterm + notify (debounced)
Modules: ui/model.rs, ui/view.rs, ui/input.rs, ui/style.rs, ui/cache.rs
Data flow: TaskStore -> view model -> render tree
Threading: background loader + channel to UI loop
Acceptance: architecture note + module boundaries + data structs

title: Data loading + snapshot strategy
body:
Priority: .git/sv/tasks.snapshot.json then .tasks/tasks.snapshot.json
Fallback: fold log only if no snapshot (with warning banner)
Selection persistence: keep by task id on reload
Sort order: status rank -> updated_at desc -> id
Acceptance: spec for data sources + selection rules + sort rules

title: Renderer: list/detail + caching + virtualization
body:
Render only visible list window + detail viewport
Cache list rows by (task_id, width, selected)
Cache detail body by (task_id, width)
Markdown render cached; fallback to wrapped text if perf fails
Acceptance: renderer plan + cache invalidation rules

title: File watch + reload pipeline
body:
Watch: .tasks/tasks.jsonl, .tasks/tasks.snapshot.json, .git/sv/tasks.*
Debounce reload 150-300ms; coalesce bursts
On change: background reload -> UI message -> swap model
Handle watch errors gracefully in status banner
Acceptance: watch spec + error handling plan

title: Filter + status shortcuts behavior
body:
Fuzzy filter over id + title; incremental search
Quick status filters: o=open, p=in_progress, c=closed, a=all
Clear: esc; toggle: /; indicator row in header
Acceptance: filtering spec + keymap integration

title: Docs update for task viewer
body:
Add docs/task_viewer.md: UX, keymap, perf budgets, data sources
Update docs/prd-tasks.md with TUI entry + v1/v2 scope
Update docs/README.md index
Acceptance: docs merged and linked

title: Test plan for TUI logic
body:
Unit tests for filter, sort, selection preservation
Cache invalidation tests (width change, selection change)
No heavy e2e; note manual UI checks
Acceptance: test plan doc + initial tests implemented

title: v2 actions spec: start/close/comment
body:
Read-only v1; v2 adds start/close/comment actions
Design: use existing TaskStore ops (no shelling)
Confirm status transitions + actor handling
Acceptance: v2 spec + safety prompts

title: Add additional TUI commands
body:
We want the following commands added to the TUI:
- 'n' to add a new task, takes you to a TUI wizard for adding title, priority, related tasks/epics, and description etc. Based on the commands available. The only required one is TITLE. 
- 'p' to set/change priority on currently seelcted task
- 'e' to edit the task, using an inline editor similar to the one we can be using for the 'Add new task TUI'

title: Epic: Additional TUI commands
body:
Epic to deliver new task creation and editing commands in the TUI.

Scope
- Add 'n' new task wizard (title required; optional priority/relations/description).
- Add 'p' change priority for selected task.
- Add 'e' inline edit for selected task.
- Update keybindings/help so users can discover new commands.
- Add reasonable test coverage for the new flows.

title: TUI: New task wizard ('n')
body: Add a TUI flow for creating a new task. Required field: title. Optional fields: priority, related tasks/epics, description. Support cancel/back and confirm before create. Persist via existing task creation pathway.

title: TUI: Change priority ('p')
body: Add a command to set/change priority for the currently selected task. Provide a small priority picker and persist via sv task update. Handle cancel and no-op when unchanged.

title: TUI: Inline edit selected task ('e')
body: Add inline editor for selected task (title and description at minimum). Reuse/new component similar to new task wizard; require confirmation before save. Handle cancel and validation errors.

title: TUI: Update keybindings/help for n/p/e
body: Expose new commands in the TUI help/command list and any on-screen hints. Keep language short and consistent with existing UX.

title: Tests: TUI new/edit/priority flows
body: Add or extend tests to cover new task wizard, priority change, and inline edit flows. Focus on validation (title required), cancel/no-op behavior, and persistence.

title: TUI: Shared editor components
body: Extract or build shared TUI components/state for task create/edit flows (fields, validation, navigation, confirm/cancel). Used by new task wizard and inline edit.

title: Modify shared editor for tas
body: In inline editor, we should not adhere to other shortcuts when writing in the field. We can call this the 'inner field'. Let 'enter' go into insert mode for the selected field. when in insert mode 'enter' or tab goes to normal mode and selects the next field. insert mode of Priotity should open a similar select option as 'p' in normal mode in list TUI, the select should have its choices text colored similar to how they are represented in the list TUI. Parent should list existing tas

title: Change list TUI commands
body: instead of having all statuses filtered diretly on a/o/i/c bind them to a 's' command that opens a status filter select with the four statuses. invcluding no filter.

title: Add fields to edit mode
body: Edit mode should have all the fields as new tas"
Edit mode should have all fields as new tasks have, allowing us to add previously none existing relations and the like
instead of having all statuses filtered directly on a/o/i/c, allow us to tab inside the / filter and select status filter through there.

title: List TUI: Change staus easily with 's'

body: In list normal mode, let 's' be a select for the statuses that the currently selected task can be set, and on 'enter' set that status for that task. 'esc' to escape/cancel

In inline editor, we should not adhere to other shortcuts when writing in the field. We can call this the 'inner field'. Let 'enter' go into insert mode for the selected field. when in insert mode 'enter' or tab goes to normal mode and selects the next field. insert mode of Priotity should open a similar select option as 'p' in normal mode in list TUI, the select should have its choices text colored similar to how they are represented in the list TUI. Parent should list existing task Ids and the titles. Allow for search completion. Relates should be called Children, and should modify the selected tasks to have this task as parent after creation/edit. Relate note should be removed, unsure if that has any purpose. Description should be called Body and be the second field in the list, should have the same behaviour as Title.

title: Inline editor: inner field key handling
body: In inline editor, ignore other shortcuts while editing a field. Enter should switch into insert mode for the selected field. In insert mode, Enter or Tab returns to normal mode and selects the next field.

title: Inline editor: priority field select
body: Priority insert mode should open a select similar to 'p' in list TUI. Choice text should use the same colors as in list TUI.

title: Inline editor: parent field task lookup
body: Parent field should list existing task IDs + titles with search/autocomplete.

title: Inline editor: rename Relates to Children
body: Rename Relates to Children and, on create/edit, set selected tasks' parent to this task.

title: Inline editor: remove relate note
body: Remove the relate note field; it's likely unnecessary.

title: Inline editor: rename Description to Body
body: Rename Description to Body, place it second in the field list, and give it the same behavior as Title.

title: Inline editor improvements (epic)
body: Epic to track inline editor UX improvements. Child tasks cover: inner-field key handling, priority select styling, parent lookup/autocomplete, rename Relates->Children behavior, remove relate note, rename Description->Body, and edit mode fields (sv-j5a).

title: Fix parallel sv take lease creation JSON parse error
body: concurrency_stress lease_creation_is_safe_under_parallel_calls fails with JSON trailing characters under concurrent sv take

title: Improve shared edit/add task editor
body: Body should be possible to write and edit as if it were a vim editor. I need to be able to seethe multiple lines and full text while writing.

title: Fix inline editor select options
body: All of Priority, Parent, and Children aren't focused when selected inside the inline editor. So we can select choices until we close out of the inline editor, defeating the purpose of them. Only the topmost inline shoild have focus and catch all keystrokes.

title: Add 'ctrl+enter' option in inline editor
body: When in inline editor, if all feilds look okay, we should be able to always use 'ctrl+enter' to go to the confirmation scren, as if we just pressed enter on the last field.

title: TUI Inline editor Improvements
body:
- Body editing is still getting truncated after one line. Should perhaps change layout to use the same pane as 'DetailsÂ§ use, Just call it either 'New task' or 'Edit Task' perhaps? Makes for a more intuitive TUI.
- Selecting Children with 'enter' did not open task multi selection as it should. Similar UI to Parent, just with the addition to allow use to select multiple tasks with 'space'

title: Expand upon task of changing the inline editor layout
body: The mention of using the second Pane as the shared editor seem s better than current implementation. Gives us more sace to work with. Make an Epic of that task and split up the comment into neeeded subtaksto fulfill that change. Make the tasks small and consise enough that a context window isn't broken by  dureing development.

title: Epic: Inline editor shared pane layout
body: Use the Details pane as the shared inline editor for New/Edit task flows. Break work into small subtasks (layout, truncation fix, children multi-select).

title: Refactor inline editor to use Details pane
body: Use the Details pane for New/Edit task editor (shared layout). Update header text to New Task / Edit Task.

title: Fix inline editor body truncation after first line
body: Body input currently truncates after one line; ensure multi-line editing works in inline editor.

title: Enable multi-select in Children picker
body: Selecting Children with Enter should open the picker; allow multi-select with Space (similar to Parent selector).

comment: Resolved by moving the editor into the Details pane so multi-line body input has full height, plus existing newline handling and tests.

title: EPIC: Add vim-like editing experience to text editing/insertion
body: The body editing experience is poor. Can we when entering insert text mode here, open a vim editor for that field?\n- When we save and quit editing this field we should read from the file write buffer to take that text and insert into the Body field instead. This will make the UX here much better.\n- Noticed that I can confirm creation of the new task now. It is blocked by the Children step. Add a 'c' command (for create task) that takes us right to the confirmation dialog.

title: TUI: prepare external editor session for Body field
body: Suspend TUI, write Body to temp file, launch / (fallback vim), then restore terminal. Surface a clear error if no editor is found or launch fails.

title: TUI: sync Body field from external editor buffer
body: On editor exit, read temp file contents and update Body field. Preserve exact content (including empty); handle non-zero exit by keeping prior body and showing an error message.

title: TUI: add 'c' command to jump to confirmation dialog
body: Allow pressing 'c' in the new task editor to attempt confirm immediately (bypass Children step) and show confirmation dialog. Update key hints/help text.
Suspend TUI, write Body to temp file, launch editor from  then  (fallback to vi), then restore terminal. Surface a clear error if no editor is found or launch fails.
Suspend TUI, write Body to temp file, launch editor from $VISUAL then $EDITOR (fallback to vi), then restore terminal. Surface a clear error if no editor is found or launch fails.

title: TUI: use external editor for Body field by default
body: Replace inline Body insert with external editor flow; entering Body edit should always launch the editor (no extra keybinding). Update any help text that mentions inline insert.

title: Fix issue with parent and children relations
body:
There is no way in new/edit mode to unassign a parent to a task. Unsure if the `sv task unrelate` is working or not
The Children selection doesn't preselct previously selected tasks.
The Children selection doesn't clear out relations if no task is selected and we press 'enter'. It should. We need a way to unassign relations.

title: Add 'd' command to delete a task
body:
Use a confirmation dialogasking the user if they are sure they wnt to delete the task.
Should unassign all relations, then remove the task

title: Test of new task
body: Here is a description

title: Make colours more palatable for new/edit tasks
body:
Make placeholder text the same gray as List panels task Id
Make the Field label white
Can we make the colors be the same regardless of the terminals colorscheme

title: Add '?' command
body:
Let '?' commad in list and edit/add neew task show an inline view of the rest of the commands now as we get som amny of them.
The only commands e should keep are:
- 'enter'/'c' to conirm
- 'j/k' for navigating up and down
- 'tab' for next field
- 'esc'/'q' for cancel/quit
